item.title: Legacy `C` in modern C++
item.description: [tl;dr] The integration of C in C++ was designed a long time ago and the mechanisms are efficient but spartan, forcing the client code to take care to manage memory and data access. When integrating into modern C++, where there is often a culture of good memory management and pointer manipulation, these mechanisms are not comfortable. There are solutions to interface C code more cleanly, through OOP or or C++ smart pointers.

item.title: Modern C++ singleton implementation through an example
